comment: This is the most unorganized professor I've had since being at KSU. He is always late to class and or doesn't show up to class he ghosted us twice, forgot about class. His assignments are all over the place, and most don't have due dates or rubrics. I'm not a negative person and I'm very eager to learn but I feel like I learned nothing from him.

Wow this class was honestly terrible and the professor was 90% the reason why. He never answered emails or even in class questions properly. He also made comments towards me that made me feel incredibly uncomfortable. Avoid at all costs if possible

I took this as an online class and it was perfect. There were no quizzes or tests, just assignments and discussions that he gave plenty of time and instruction to complete. He makes sure students don't feel overwhelmed, and you can work at your own pace too. I finished this class in october from working ahead.

Super nice and explains things with ease as long as you pay attention :) These days people have a really short attention span so they like to blame external factors (like profs) for their bad performance.

he was okay, he took a while to reply to emails, and while he supplied clear rubrics, he was a hard grader. I was able to get an A because I prioritized this class, do not fall behind, he is not very lenient.

The assignments themselves were not hard the class itself was not hard, but he cannot grade on time, he gets lazy even though he gives us opportunity to turn in missing assignments, I just genuinely don't understand what his problem is. He opened up a drop box and I think I resubmitted at least 3 assignments and he didn't grade any of them.

This class was honestly a joke. It wasn't incredibly difficult, but Dr. Ukeje rarely responded to emails and when he did, they weren't on time. Syllabus changes were also very confusing in this class and nothing in the grading criteria was clarified. Avoid this professor if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This class is pretty, easy mainly discussion posts but at the end of the semester he kind of piles on work but as long as you get it done in time, you will be fine. He is easy to talk to through email. A lot of people crap on him but they also expect not to do the work on time. Do you work and submit it on time, you will get a good grade
Did not elaborate enough on course and assignment requirements. Gave no instruction. Extremely difficult professor and I'm surprised I even passed. If you have the choice, DO NOT take him

Late to reply to emails, does not care about student success, dismissive, unprofessional, and not a good example for future teachers. It's the last week & over half of the course ungraded. The course was made by Mark Warner, so he is not familiar with it. I have never had an issue with a prof until him. PLEASE listen when I say AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Please avoid taking this professor if you can. He rarely ever responds to emails at all. The structure of this course with this professor was unorganized and overall very confusing. His feedback is passive-aggressive and does not clear up much information or clarification when asked.

Dr. Ukeje is interesting but is a good professor. overall his class was easy however class is 100% mandatory because almost all of our assignments and things to help us with our assignments were given in class including our big group project at the end of the semester. All work is turned in online though, final and midterm in person on paper.

I loved Dr. Ukeje's class; this was a hybrid class, so we only meet once a week. To do well in this class you need to read the assigned texts, show up to class, and complete the synopsis. ANY LATE WORK HE ACCEPTED UNTIL TWO DAYS BEFORE GRADES WERE DUE. There is one group project which is not difficult, as long as you know what you're talking about.

He take forever to grade but that is really the only downfall. He is very nice and understanding. He cares about his students and wants them to be successful. If you come to class and turn in your work you will make an A.
This professor loves what he teaches! The class was lively and enjoyable!

I hate to be negative, but this class and professor was a mess. He never responded to my emails, changed things all the time, never gave us PowerPoints, doesn't communicate well, gets defensive and mad easily, grades everything so weird and doesn't provide rubrics, waited to grade everything the week grades were due, and requires 3 books.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ukeje was not the best. He changed due dates and requirements all the time. The midterm and final were very long and hard since his lectures and PowerPoints were all over the place. He actually kicked us out of class once for not having our textbook with us even though he never told us to bring them. There is a lot of reading and writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ukeje and his class was a mess. He requires 3 different books and we barley used each but still needed them to write papers. We wrote papers "synopsis" on everything we read. He waited till the last minute to grade everything. He gave us the review for the final two days beforehand. He changed due dates and requirements constantly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor needs to work on his communication skills. His instructions are often unclear, & when you ask for clarification, he gets defensive & is condescending. He's awful at corresponding emails. It can take more than 3 days for him to reply. His lectures are not engaging, and he makes you purchase 3 books that are only used once!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: dr. ukeje was pretty average. def not the worst professor, but i've had better. i'm not a huge fan of his lectures, but he tends to grade relatively easy on assignments. midterm and final weren't terrible difficult, and he definitely cares for his students even if he can be slightly boring during class. good professor, with room for improvement.

He wasn't the worst choice but definitely not my favorite; you buy 3 textbooks but really don't need any except the psychology book. You buy a $30 book (phenomenal teaching) only to have a group project on ONE chapter of it, that's it. He just canceled a lot of assignments. His grading is weird, two tests that cover EVERYTHING but get extra credit
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This prof is pretty average honestly There were a lot of assignments so be prepared to be busy in this class but he cares about his students He gave everyone the opportunity to turn in any missing assignments There are a lot of papers and synopsis's so be prepared to write. His personality is an aquired taste but you can tell he wants u to succeed

Dr. Ukeje is a passionate and knowledgeable professor! The only issue my class had was communication. He rarely responds to emails, due dates are different all over D2L, there isn't really instruction in the assignments- overall just a lot of room for misunderstandings. He does work with you during class tho! Just be prepared to be confused often
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: he doesnt respond to emails. i have sent him emails about assignments and asked during the zoom meeting in the chat, but he just ignores me. he assigns work in the announcements on d2l, but doesnt explain them during class, so everyone always has questions. he is also pretty rude when you ask questions and barely talks about the assigned readings

There is a disconnect in communication and expectations which makes things difficult. If you participate you will pass. Overall, Dr. Ukeje is willing to work with you and tries his best to make things easier for us all.

This class was a joke. He makes you buy multiple textbooks but the assignments can be completed through google. He only grades at the end of the semester so you have no idea where you are the entire semester. He goes off on tangents that have nothing to do with the class as well as makes jokes about class being cancelled when its not. Overall chaos
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I have had few professors who have frustrated me as much as Professor Ukeje. His syllabus is a wreck and hes unclear in his instruction. His lectures are a train wreck and I missed one class for my brothers wedding. That day he showed the class their test grades and he yelled at me for 15 minutes for asking what I needed to do to see my grade.

TAKE HIM! I actually learned in his class compared to other profs. His lectures are interesting and fun. His assignments arent hard and theres not a lot of them. He doesn't try to make your life harder then it is. His instructions are sometimes unclear and he doesn't put grades in until late but just do the work and put effort and youll be fine.

I was nervous to have him cause his rating on here is low but he's great! The only way to fail this class is to really try and not do any work and if that's you, why are you in college? The only complaint I hate is he's sometimes unclear with instructions and you don't know your grade until last but if you put effort and do the work you'' be fine.

Dr. Ukeje is a fine professor. He knows a lot about teaching and has a lot of experience in the field. He is also very flexible and understanding about deadlines and such. The only complaint I have is that he doesn't post grades until the very end of the semester and can come off a bit rude. That being said - I've had much worse professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. Dr. Ukeje is a prime example of how having a doctorate degree doesn't make you an effective educator. His emails are rude and detached, his assignments are confusing, and his syllabus is a mess of wrong dates and unutilized assignments. Avoid him at all costs.

Do not take him online. We went almost four months without a syllabus and when he finally posted it, he had to remove it since none of it made sense. We have 2 weeks left of school and have no grades, no definitive due dates, and no information about assignments at all. When you upload assignments, you just guess as to what should be in them.

An absolute nightmare. We have 2 weeks left of the semester and he has not graded a single thing. Completely unorganized and when he tries to fix it he makes it even worse. Most confusing class i have ever had just due to the lack of organization. Has given no feedback on any work, so know one knows if they are doing things right or not.
I really liked him. His class was pretty unorganized and kind of a mess, but he is a great guy and grades very easily. I had fun in his class and met great people

Um idk why I thought taking Ukeje would be a good idea. At one point we had gone 2 weeks without a syllabus and when they re-uploaded it, it was still wrong!! Its around midterm time and we have had about 6 assignments all together... this is honestly the most confusing, disorganized, and disappointing class I've ever taken.

He didn't upload any work for weeks. When he did, it had the wrong reading from a book we didn't have. He'd then move the deadline or remove the assignment altogether. There were about 3 small assignments all summer. Then, the last week he uploaded 5 assignment, including 3 major papers, due within one week. Grading is due and I have no grades.

This professor has an amazing background which makes the class interesting. He is supportive. He is a little old-school so if you need to talk to him, I would stay a few minutes after class to talk. He is very chill and works with you when there is an issue. Yes, some things are not organized or clear, but the class is very easy and he is great.
I love this man, he's so nice and is just so funny.
I would not recommend taking this prof. He is lazy and gets off track constantly. If you want any grades back before 5pm on the last day of the semester, forget it. He loses assignments constantly.

This professor is very disorganized. There were no directions for any of the assignments. It was a waste to email him because he simply wouldn't respond. He also wouldn't give students his office #. It is December now and I still haven't received grades from August. He also has disappeared for an entire month when all of our assignments are due.

Very disorganized. You have to push him to be clear about assignments. Forgot to open a drop-box every week the first 5 weeks and ended up pushing the assignment back a week every time. He has a lot of excuses for this and about half of them lay blame on the students somehow. That said, he's an easy grader and very willing to push due dates back.

This was a summer class and he was not at all clear on the guidelines. It took him 5 days for us to get the syllabus and even then it did not align with D2L. I emailed him over 5 times before he responded to our confusions about the assignments, and even still the class set up is not clear. For a 2 month class, I did not know what was going on.

He is very lecture heavy, but is very interesting and funny. He is extremely smart, but knows how to dumb things down. There is tons of group work, a few random quizzes if the class doesn't participate, and he doesn't use D2L at all. If you need anything just go talk to him.

Professor Ukeje is a very nice guy with a lot of degrees. He has a really cool background which makes him very interesting. His teaching is a different story. He constantly asks random people questions so you have to be paying attention throughout the whole class. If your response is wrong he is very rude about it. Easy grader, boring class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a very smart guy, has a bunch of degrees. He really cares about the subject material and loves seeing his students do well. Most grades are given out as part of a group assignment. He assigns the group, but if someone isnt working out and you let him know he will change things for you.

his syllabus is straightforward. he lets you know at semester beginning of assignments and due dates.  All assignments are handed in.  he doesn't really use D2L.  no discussion board but he does place you in a group and you have a group project and a group paper
